faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit vastgoed?
faqs.answer: €660,000. This represents €4,000 per square meter for premium construction, 40% less than equivalent villas on Spanish islands. The price includes the 750m² plot and sophisticated interior finishes. Payment plans and mortgage financing through Spanish and international lenders are available.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders vastgoed kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreigners enjoy full property ownership rights in Spain with no restrictions on nationality or residency status. British, EU, and non-EU citizens purchase property routinely. A Spanish tax number (NIE) and legal representation streamline the acquisition process, typically completed within 4-6 weeks.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van het kopen van vastgoed in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Total acquisition costs typically range 10-12% of purchase price. Transfer tax (ITP) averages 6-8%, notarial and registration fees account for 1-2%, and legal representation costs €800-1,500. Renovation or furnishing expenses vary by buyer intentions. First-year property taxes are minimal; ongoing annual IBI (property tax) averages €300-500 for similar properties.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om vastgoed te kopen?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca represents Europe's premier established property market for international buyers. Consistent appreciation (+8% annually in quality developments), mature infrastructure, international community, and favorable taxation make it exceptional. Sucina specifically offers premium lifestyle at remarkable value compared to coastal resort areas.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish banks routinely finance foreign buyers at 60-70% loan-to-value. UK lenders also finance Spanish property. Requirements include proof of income, credit history, and typically a 30-40% deposit. Mortgage rates remain favorable at 3-4.5% for quality borrowers. Discuss options with your legal representative during purchase planning.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value compared to UK and Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a couple average €1,200-1,800 including rent/mortgage, utilities, dining, and entertainment. Healthcare and education costs are minimal. Sucina's inland location provides 15-20% savings versus coastal resort areas. Luxury lifestyle with private services remains affordable.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca geschikt voor gepensioneerden?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca ranks among Europe's top retirement destinations. Year-round climate eliminates seasonal depression. Healthcare quality matches UK standards at lower cost. The established expatriate community provides social integration. Affordable living combined with cultural amenities, golf, and beaches creates ideal retirement conditions. Many residents enjoy active lifestyles well into their 80s.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys 320+ sunshine days annually with temperatures averaging 17°C in winter and 28°C in summer. Mediterranean climate means mild winters without freezing, warm summers without excessive heat. Rainfall concentrates in autumn and spring; summer remains consistently dry. This climate supports year-round outdoor living and golf.

faqs.question: Welke huurinkomsten kan ik verwachten van dit vastgoed?
